author: Special Correspondent
text:
The fourth State-level ISTE students’ convention for polytechnics was held recently at Mallasamudram near here.

K. Sundaramoorthy Additional Director, Directorate of Technical Education, in his address said that the convention was to promote technical vision in the minds of budding technocrats, research scholars, representing educational institutions and industries. This initiative had provided a knowledge ground for a spectrum of technical ideas on innovation in the field of technical education.

The convention was presided over by M. G. Bharathkumar, chairman, Mahendra Institutions.

A.K. Natesan, president, Indian Society for Technical Education (ISTE) – Tamil Nadu and Puducherry section, delivered key-note address.

B. Maha Ajay Prasad, managing director of Mahendra Institions, and Sivalingam, principal, Mahendra Polytechnic College, offered felicitations. Prizes were awarded to the best project displayed and paper presentation.
title: Students’ convention for polytechnics held
